Description: Typical range for industrial cleaning of precious metals like platinum to avoid thermal damage; starting at 100W for light contamination. Based on CleanLaser and IPG Photonics specs for 1064 nm systems (e.g., CL 100 series).
Near-IR wavelength optimized for Platinum's moderate reflectivity and thermal processing
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning with adequate energy density
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage with controlled thermal input
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal while minimizing Platinum substrate heating
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning coverage
Recommended number of passes for thorough cleaning of Platinum surfaces
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal accumulation
